result.execSummary:
The defendant Forrest J Hobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $500.00; 
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA).

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
- Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Forrest J Hobson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Forrest J Hobson in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Forrest J Hobson.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

- Provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $500.00; 
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Forrest J Hobson in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin not in court.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is unavailable, in court in another branch. Court adjourned matter for plea and sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Forrest J Hobson in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Forrest J Hobson.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling conference on August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Forrest J Hobson in court, appear by video with attorney Michael L. Chernin, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Rothstein. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Forrest J Hobson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/22 @ 1p
